resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
kszucs commented on issue #6420: ARROW-7874: [Python][Archery] Validate docstrings with numpydoc
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6420#issuecomment-587472087
 
 
   @jorisvandenbossche I've added an standalone archery command for running it, because it requires pyarrow to be avilable for import during runtime. You can also pass a list of rules to ignore or include.
   
   ```bash
   archery numpydoc --whitelist ... --blacklist ...
   archery numpydoc -w RULE1 -w RULE2  # enable two rules
   archery numpydoc -b RULE1 -b RULE2  # desallow two rules
   ```
   
   It will help with iterating over the high priority violations.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

jorisvandenbossche commented on pull request #6420: ARROW-7874: [Python][Archery] Validate docstrings with numpydoc
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6420#discussion_r380784233
 
 

 ##########
 File path: dev/archery/archery/lang/python.py
 ##########
 @@ -0,0 +1,118 @@
+# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
+# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
+# distributed with this work for additional information
+# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
+# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
+# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
+# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+#
+#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+#
+# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
+# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
+# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
+# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
+# specific language governing permissions and limitations
+# under the License.
+
+import importlib
+from contextlib import contextmanager
+
+try:
+    from numpydoc.validate import Docstring, validate
+except ImportError:
+    have_numpydoc = False
+else:
+    have_numpydoc = True
+
+from ..utils.command import Command, default_bin
+
+
+class Flake8(Command):
+    def __init__(self, flake8_bin=None):
+        self.bin = default_bin(flake8_bin, "flake8")
+
+
+class NumpyDoc:
+
+    def __init__(self, modules=None):
+        if not have_numpydoc:
+            raise RuntimeError(
+                'Numpydoc is not available, install the development version '
+                'of it via pip ...'
+            )
+        self.modules = set(modules or {'pyarrow'})
+
+    def traverse(self, fn, obj, from_package):
+        """Apply a function on publicly exposed API components.
+
+        Recursively iterates over the members of the passed object. It omits
+        any '_' prefixed and thirdparty (non pyarrow) symbols.
+
+        Parameters
+        ----------
+        obj : Any
+        from_package : string, default 'pyarrow'
+            Predicate to only consider objects from this package.
+        """
+        todo = [obj]
+        seen = set()
+
+        while todo:
+            obj = todo.pop()
+            if obj in seen:
+                continue
+            else:
+                seen.add(obj)
+
+            fn(obj)
+
+            for name in dir(obj):
+                if name.startswith('_'):
+                    continue
+
+                member = getattr(obj, name)
+                module = getattr(member, '__module__', None)
+                if not (module and module.startswith(from_package)):
+                    continue
+
+                todo.append(member)
+
+    @contextmanager
+    def _patch_numpydoc(self):
+        original = Docstring._load_obj
+        try:
+            Docstring._load_obj = staticmethod(lambda obj: obj)
 
 Review comment:
   Why is this patching needed?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

+# specific language governing permissions and limitations
+# under the License.
+
+import importlib
+from contextlib import contextmanager
+
+try:
+    from numpydoc.validate import Docstring, validate
+except ImportError:
+    have_numpydoc = False
+else:
+    have_numpydoc = True
+
+from ..utils.command import Command, default_bin
+
+
+class Flake8(Command):
+    def __init__(self, flake8_bin=None):
+        self.bin = default_bin(flake8_bin, "flake8")
+
+
+class NumpyDoc:
+
+    def __init__(self, modules=None):
+        if not have_numpydoc:
+            raise RuntimeError(
+                'Numpydoc is not available, install the development version '
+                'of it via pip ...'
+            )
+        self.modules = set(modules or {'pyarrow'})
+
+    def traverse(self, fn, obj, from_package):
+        """Apply a function on publicly exposed API components.
+
+        Recursively iterates over the members of the passed object. It omits
+        any '_' prefixed and thirdparty (non pyarrow) symbols.
+
+        Parameters
+        ----------
+        obj : Any
+        from_package : string, default 'pyarrow'
+            Predicate to only consider objects from this package.
+        """
+        todo = [obj]
+        seen = set()
+
+        while todo:
+            obj = todo.pop()
+            if obj in seen:
+                continue
+            else:
+                seen.add(obj)
+
+            fn(obj)
+
+            for name in dir(obj):
+                if name.startswith('_'):
+                    continue
+
+                member = getattr(obj, name)
+                module = getattr(member, '__module__', None)
+                if not (module and module.startswith(from_package)):
+                    continue
+
+                todo.append(member)
+
+    @contextmanager
+    def _patch_numpydoc(self):
+        original = Docstring._load_obj
+        try:
+            Docstring._load_obj = staticmethod(lambda obj: obj)
 
 Review comment:
   `_load_obj` expects an import path, but I'm getting objects from the API travelsal, and producing proper `__qualname__` paths is challenging with cython.
   
   I'm adding a comment.

jorisvandenbossche commented on issue #6420: ARROW-7874: [Python][Archery] Validate docstrings with numpydoc
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6420#issuecomment-588207630
 
 
   In the output, I see things like
   
   ```
   pyarrow.lib.table
   -> table(data, names=None, schema=None, metadata=None)
   SS03: Summary does not end with a period
   SS06: Summary should fit in a single line
   PR02: Unknown parameters {'data', 'schema', 'metadata', 'names'}
   SA04: Missing description for See Also "Table.from_arrays" reference
   SA04: Missing description for See Also "Table.from_pandas" reference
   SA04: Missing description for See Also "Table.from_pydict" reference
   ```
   
   So it seems that for cython methods the parameters are not recognized? (I thought this worked in pandas, though, I might need to check)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

   ```python
   >>> import pyarrow as pa
   ```

kszucs commented on issue #6420: ARROW-7874: [Python][Archery] Validate docstrings with numpydoc
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6420#issuecomment-588218075
 
 
   Numpydoc [looks for the signature](https://github.com/numpy/numpydoc/blob/master/numpydoc/validate.py#L289), but: 
   
   ```python
   >>> import pyarrow as pa
   >>> import inspect
   >>> inspect.signature(pa.table)
   ValueError: no signature found for builtin <built-in function table>
   ```

kszucs commented on issue #6420: ARROW-7874: [Python][Archery] Validate docstrings with numpydoc
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6420#issuecomment-588225263
 
 
   Yeah, cython doesn't set `__text_signature__` for the cdef'd classes and functions, despite that embedsignature directive is set to True, and `inspect.signature` looks for that property.

kszucs commented on issue #6420: ARROW-7874: [Python][Archery] Validate docstrings with numpydoc
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6420#issuecomment-588344408
 
 
   @jorisvandenbossche I managed to add a workaround, so now we can parse the signature of `pa.table` as 
   
   ```python
   <Signature (data, names=None, schema=None, metadata=None)>
   ```
   
   It alseo required some additional gymnastics to get rid of the cython specific typehints, se we convert
   
   ```python
   array(obj, type=None, mask=None, size=None, from_pandas=None,
         bool safe=True, MemoryPool memory_pool=None)
   ```
   To:
   ```python
   <Signature (obj, type=None, mask=None, size=None, from_pandas=None,
               safe=True, memory_pool=None)>
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Numpydoc's master have support for validating numpy flavored docstrings. 
This enables to check the docstrings automatically from CI.
